entries.name: Ammo+
entries: This weapon requires advanced ammunition to fire, usually gunpowder, bullets, or magazines.

entries.name: Arisen Weapon
entries: So long as you remain bound to your Arisen, you are considered proficient in this weapon. If you ever are to become unbound to your Arisen, the weapon vanishes, and so do any benefits it gives.

No creature other than the bonded target may use or hold this weaponâ€”the action becomes physically impossible whenever attempted. In addition, you gain the ability to summon this weapon as a bonus action on your turn, causing it to instantly appear equipped onto your form and become attuned (if you have a free attunement slot).

entries.name: Returning
entries: When a thrown weapon also carrying the returning property is thrown as part of an attack, it returns to its wielder immediately after the attack. When throwing a returning weapon, you can choose to not have it return in order to add 5 feet to its short range and 10 feet to its long range.

entries.name: Overwhelming Force
entries: On a critical hit, the target is knocked prone if you attacked from within normal range of the shotgun.

entries.name: Variable
entries: The properties of this item varies.

entries.name: Technological
entries: As a pure technological item, nothing as to how this item functions is a result of magic, and as such, it is unaffected by spells such as dispel magic and antimagic circle.

entries.name: Consumable
entries: This item is consumed on use.

entries.name: Variable Weapon
entries: The type of this weapon varies.

item.name: Petal Dancer Ward
entries: This cape is made of colorful, aromatic petals. As you walk, a dusting of petals drift behind you, disappearing before they touch the ground. You can change the color of the petals using a bonus action. While you wear and are attuned to this cape, you can cast the {@spell druidcraft} cantrip at will, and creatures with a sense of smell make attacks of opportunity against you with disadvantage.
{@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}

item.name: Firecracker Crystals
entries: These multicolored crystals are usually purchased in small bags at festivals and holiday events. As an action, you can throw one of these inch-long crystals against a solid surface to crack it apart. When broken in this way, a crystal releases the stored magic inside. The magic ends at the end of your turn and is entirely sensory.

A bag of the small crystals comes with {@dice 1d4+8} (10) crystals inside. Roll a number of {@dice 1d8} equal to the number of crystals in the bag and record each number rolled. Use these numbers to determine the kinds of crystals found in the bag using the table below

rows: ...a plume of harmless flame 5 feet tall.
...a small flash of bright light in a 5 foot radius and dim light for another 5 feet, followed by the smell of spices and citrus.
...small spiraling motes of energy that fizz and fly about in a 5-foot radius
...a cloud of colorful verdant smoke that fills a 5-foot sphere that smells both foul and sweet at once.
...a series of comically large bubbles that float outward from the point of impact in a 5-foot radius.
...a dazzling display of sparkling glitter in a 5-foot radius from the point of impact.
...the sound of music. The song is random, and plays only enough to make it recognizable as music.
...a mystery effect. Roll on the table again when using this crystal to determine its effect. If you roll an 8, roll again.

entries: {@italic Item submitted by @Nevermore#9950.}

item.name: Catnip Amulet
entries: This gold and jade amulet seems to draw domestic cats to it. While wearing the necklace, you have advantage on ability checks made to find or call Tiny domestic cats (if there are any) and on Wisdom (Animal Handling checks you make to interact with them.
{@italic Item submitted by @Nevermore#9950.}

item.name: Aci Feather
entries: While this feather is equipped on your person, you can use a bonus action to make your hair dramatically blow in a nonexistent breeze.

item.name: Returning Weapon
entries: When this weapon is thrown as part of an attack, it returns to its wielder immediately after the attack.
{@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}
{@italic {@bold Base items}}. This item variant can be applied to the following base items:

item.name: Cap of the Cartographer
entries: {@italic Do you suck at reading maps? At telling which way is north, south, east, weast?! Fear no more! The Cap of the Cartographer is just what you need!}
While wearing this dark blue flat cap, you can see where you are on any map you are holding that contains your current location.
{@italic Item designed by @Gebri#6969.}

item.name: Doodle Ring
entries: This magic wooden ring is always covered in splotches of charcoal, ink, or paint, regardless of how well or often it's cleaned. While wearing the ring on a finger, you can touch that finger to a solid surface and begin to draw. The drawing uses your finger to make marks as if it were a piece of charcoal, ink quill, or paintbrush (your choice). The marks you make can be in any color. Any drawing made by the ring can be easily smudged away without leaving any marks behind. The ring can have up to 5 square feet covered with drawings in this way at any time. Drawing more than that begins to erase the previous marks, and any mark left after 24 hours of being made is magically erased.
{@italic Item submitted by Nevermore#9950.}

item.name: Candy Xorn
entries: Candy xorn is a round, waxy candy that typically comes in small bags of {@dice 2d6+3} pieces. Each piece is traditionally either orange or yellow, but always has a narrow, reptilian pupil drawn at its center. Eating a candy xorn causes your eyes to turn orange or yellow (your choice), and your pupils to match the ones found on the piece of candy. After 1 minute, the effect ends and your eyes return to normal.

In addition, each piece of candy xorn has a 5 percent chance to not be candy at all, but actually a gemstone covered in the sugar coating. When you find a gemstone in this way, it can be either eye agate (40%, 10gp), tiger's eye (40%, 10gp), or amber (20%, 100gp)
{@italic Item submitted by Nevermore#9950.}

item.name: Returning Weapon +1
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
When this weapon is thrown as part of an attack, it returns to its wielder immediately after the attack.
{@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}
{@italic {@bold Base items}}. This item variant can be applied to the following base items:

item.name: Returning Weapon +2
entries: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
When this weapon is thrown as part of an attack, it returns to its wielder immediately after the attack.
{@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}
{@italic {@bold Base items}}. This item variant can be applied to the following base items:

item.name: Pistol Ammo (20)
entries: Ammo for a pistol.

item.name: Rifle Ammo (20)
entries: Ammo for a rifle.

item.name: Shotgun Ammo (20)
entries: Ammo for a shotgun.

item.name: Broom of Flying
entries: This wooden broom, which weighs 3 pounds, functions like a mundane broom until you stand astride it and speak its command word. It then hovers beneath you and can be ridden in the air. It has a flying speed of 50 feet. It can carry up to 400 pounds, but its flying speed becomes 30 feet while carrying over 200 pounds. The broom stops hovering when you land.

You can send the broom to travel alone to a destination within 1 mile of you if you speak the command word, name the location, and are familiar with that place. The broom comes back to you when you speak another command word, provided that the broom is still within 1 mile of you.

item.name: Staff of Power
item.reqAttune: by a sorcerer, warlock, or wizard
entries: This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. While holding it, you gain a +1 bonus to Armor Class, saving throws, and spell attack rolls.

The staff has 20 charges for the following properties. The staff regains {@dice 2d8 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the staff retains its +1 bonus to attack and damage roll but loses all other properties. On a 20, the staff regain {@dice 1d8 + 2} charges.

entries.name: Power Strike
entries: When you hit with a melee attack using the staff, you can expend 1 charge to deal an extra {@damage 1d6} force damage to the target.

entries.name: Spells
entries: While holding this staff, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC and spell attack bonus: {@spell cone of cold} (5 charges), {@spell fireball} (5th-level version, 5 charges), {@spell globe of invulnerability} (6 charges), {@spell hold monster} (5 charges), {@spell levitate} (2 charges), {@spell lightning bolt} (5th-level version, 5 charges), {@spell magic missile} (1 charge), {@spell ray of enfeeblement} (1 charge), or {@spell wall of force} (5 charges).

item.name: Staff of Frost
item.reqAttune: by a druid, sorcerer, warlock, or wizard
entries: This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. While holding it, you gain a +1 bonus to saving throws and spell attack rolls.
You also have resistance to cold damage while you hold this staff.

The staff has 15 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC: {@spell cone of cold} (5 charges), {@spell fog cloud} (1 charge), {@spell ice storm} (4 charges), {@spell wall of ice} (4 charges), {@spell frost lance|WMPS} (3 charges), or {@spell snilloc's snowball swarm|xge} (2 charges).
The staff regains {@dice 2d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1. the staff turns to water and is destroyed.

item.name: Staff of Fire
item.reqAttune: by a druid, sorcerer, warlock, or wizard
entries: This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. While holding it, you gain a +1 bonus to saving throws and spell attack rolls.
You have resistance to fire damage while you hold this staff.

The staff has 15 charges. While holding it, you can expend the requisite number of charges to cast one of the following spells from the staff using your spell save DC: {@spell burning hands} (1 charge), {@spell continual flame} (2 charges), {@spell fireball} (3 charges), {@spell wall of fire} (4 charges), {@spell dartak's retribution|WMPS} (4 charges), or {@spell immolation|xge} (5 charges).
The staff regains {@dice 2d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the staff blackens, crumbles into cinders, and is destroyed.

item.name: Staff of Fate
entries: This transparent crystal staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it.

entries.name: Altered Outcome
entries: The staff has 6 charges. As a bonus action, you can expend 1 of the staff's charges to give yourself or one other creature that you can see a {@dice d4}. The recipient can roll this {@dice d4} and add the number rolled to one ability check, attack roll, damage roll, or saving throw it makes before the start of your next turn. If this extra die is not used before then, it is lost.

If you expend the staff's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a roll of 9 or lower, the staff becomes a nonmagical quarterstaff that breaks the first time it scores a hit and deals damage. On a roll of 10 or higher, the staff regains {@dice 1d6} of its expended charges.

item.name: Solar Surfer
entries: This custom-built machine (designed to be used by Solar Sailors in the Skywatcher Grand Prix) is designed to be small enough to be carried and even used for fast transport when travelling. Their quick-activation and portability make them a smart option for those in Accord who wish to get around quickly and faster than the required effort to retrieve a crew and pilot an airship.

The surfboard itself weighs 10 pounds and remains folded until the user speaks the command word, which can be customized for each solar surfer. While extended, the solar surfer requires direct sunlight to function. If achieved, it has a flying speed of 100 feet and can carry up to 400 pounds, but its flying speed becomes halved feet while carrying over 200 pounds.

A pilot can angle the sail to change direction, and the surfboard hovers in the air until they choose to land. A solar surfer requires a least one free hand to pilot, although a solar surfer can remain in the air with no hands on the controls (making it possible for a pilot to use a two-handed weapon while in the air).

In addition, a pilot can reflect the light of the sun through the sails at an enemy. That creature must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take {@dice 3d8+1d4} radiant damage, or half as much on a successful save. A sail's delicate living-fibers can only channel the sun's radiance 5 times before needing to be repaired, which the living-fibers does at a rate of 1 charge each dawn.

A pilot can attempt to fire an additional charge from their solar surfer beyond the fifth, but doing so will fry the internal components of the sail, and the solar surfer will immediately plummet to the ground, having become unusable and unrepairable.

item.name: Armblade
entries: An armblade is a magic weapon that attaches to your arm, becoming inseparable from you as long as you're attached to it. You attach this item to your forearm as a prosthetic.

As a bonus action, you can retract the armblade into your forearm or extend it from there. While it is extended, you can use the weapon as if you were holding it, and you can't use that hand for other purposes.

The armblade can take the form of any weapons lacking the two hand or heavy property. Additionally, you may spend an hour reconstructing your armblade to hold another valid weapon you provide. If the weapon being attached still requires attunement if it calls for it.

item.name: Lightning Lashed
entries: You can use a bonus action to speak this magic weapon's command word, causing lightning to arc over the blade or head. This lightning sheds dim light in a 10-foot radius.

While the lightning persists, it deals an extra {@dice 2d6} lightning damage to any target it hits. The lightning lasts until you use a bonus action to speak the command word again or until you drop or sheathe the weapon.
{@italic Item designed by @DIO#6259.}
{@italic {@bold Base items}}. This item variant can be applied to the following base items:

item.name: Cold Spaulder
entries: This metal shoulder guard is always chilly to the touch.  While worn, willfully ignoring another humanoid's attempt to converse with you causes them to experience a sensation of chills running down their spine.
{@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}

item.name: Blinkback Belt
entries: A set of clips are attached to this segmented belt constructed of metallic links. Up to two melee weapons or up to four light melee weapons can be hung from the belt in straps or sheaths. These weapons must not have the two-handed or double-bladed property.

When the wearer draws a weapon attached to this belt and throws it before the end of their next turn, the weapon teleports back to its strap or sheath immediately after the attack is resolved. If the weapon drops to the ground or if the wearer is disarmed of their weapon, they immediately teleport back to their belt at the start of their turn.
Removing or switching weapons requires the user to end their attunement or to attune to belt once more.
{@italic Item designed by @MiriamRose#2345.}

item.name: Conversing Mirrors
entries: This item comes in a box-set of two near-indestructible mirrors. They are connected through a planar wire that spans the entire Multiverse.

As an action, you can "ring" the other mirror, appearing as a request for communication on the adjacent mirror. Accepting the call will broadcast whatever the mirror is reflecting to the other mirror's screen, as well as voice. Either party can disconnect the mirror's connection at will, as well as turn off the reflection-sharing properties or temporarily mute the audio.
These mirrors can be used to speak long distances, commune with commanding officers, or even just keep in touch with loved ones on an arduous journey.

item.name: Lifewell Tattoo
entries: This tattoo comprises symbols of life and rebirth. While this tattoo is on your skin, you have resistance to necrotic damage.

entries.name: Life Ward
entries: When you would be reduced to 0 hit points, you drop to 1 hit point instead. Once used, this property can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Tattoo Attunement
entries: To attune to this item, you hold the needle to your skin where you want the tattoo to appear, pressing the needle there throughout the attunement process. When the attunement is complete, the needle turns into the ink that becomes the tattoo, which appears on the skin.
If your attunement to the tattoo ends, the tattoo vanishes, and the needle reappears in the closest unoccupied space to you.

item.name: Weapon of Resurgence
entries: This weapon emanates a soft green aura while in the hands of a paladin and grants a +1 to attack and damage rolls.
If you hit a creature while attuned to this weapon, you regain one point of your lay on hands. You can only gain this benefit once per turn.
{@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}
{@italic {@bold Base items}}. This item variant can be applied to the following base items:

item.name: Whistle of Duck Calling
entries: When you blow this whistle, a duck appears behind you. Once you blown on it, you must wait 5 minutes before using it again. Once used, any previous ducks summoned by this whistle disappears, and is replaced by the new duck.
{@italic Item designed by @Mr.Philanthropic#0001.}

item.name: Cloak of Cherry Blossoms
entries: While wearing this cloak, you can use a bonus action to cause a small storm of harmless cherry blossoms to flutter around you.
{@italic Item designed by @DIO#6259.}

item.name: Ghost Captain's Coat
entries: This coat is nice and crisp. Black leather runs down the entire frame of your body, like a trenchcoat, and your fancy pauldrons are made fancy with the thin tuffs of fur protruding from their edges. It truly makes you look the part of a captain.
While attuned to this coat, you gain proficiency with vehicles (water) if you do not already have it.
This coat has 3 charges. Once per day, you can cast the {@spell suggestion} spell (save DC 15) from it by expending 1 charge. You regain all expended charges each dawn.

In addition, the ghostly-fabric of the coat's make allows you to temporarily transcend boundaries. You can move through other creatures and objects other than physical barriers (such as walls, floors, or ceilings) as if they were difficult terrain. On your turn, you can pass through up to 10 feet of physical barriers (treating them as difficult terrain) as a part of your movement. If you end your turn inside an object or barrier, you take {@dice 1d10} force damage and are immediately ejected to the closest available space.
Once you move through a creature or object this way, you cannot do so again until next dawn.

item.name: Staff of the Geomancer
item.reqAttune: by a bard, cleric, druid, sorcerer, or wizard
entries: This staff has 10 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it, using your spell save DC and spellcasting ability modifier: {@spell stone shape} (1 charge), {@spell meld into stone} (2 charges), {@spell move earth} (4 charges), or {@spell wall of stone} (4 charges).
The staff regains {@dice 1d6 + 4} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the staff blackens, crumbles into cinders, and is destroyed.

item.name: Gloves of the Viper
entries: These gloves slide over your hands like a thin veil of silk, although they feel coarse and rough. Black in color with spots of green, they make an interesting fashion statement. Thankfully though, fashion isn't the primary reason for donning these gloves.

After you regain hit points using your Second Wind feature, the next ranged or melee weapon attack you successfully hit with this turn deals an additional {@dice 1d10} + half your Fighter level poison damage.

In addition, a creature hit by the attack must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Strength or Dexterity modifier. On a failed save, that creature is poisoned until the end of their next turn.

item.name: Wand of Sudden Transposition
entries: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 charge and suddenly transpose two creatures of your choice.

Choose two Small or Medium creatures that you can see within 120 feet. The creatures you select must either standing on the same surface or standing on surfaces which are physically connected by solid ground or structures.

A creature which is unwilling to be transposed must make a Charisma saving throw equal to your spell save DC. If neither creature makes a successful saving throw, both creatures are teleported, with each reappearing in the space previously occupied by the other.
This wand requires a verbal component to activate.
The wand regains {@dice 1d6 + 1} expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand's last charge, roll a {@dice d20}. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

item.name: Handkerchief of Length
entries: This item appears to be a normal silk handkerchief. However, when you place it in your pocket and speak the command word, you can then pull from your pocket a 50-foot long line of multi-colored handkerchiefs tied to each other. This functions exactly like a regular piece of rope.
When you stuff the handkerchiefs back in your pocket, they revert to the original handkerchief.

item.name: Elemental Fang, Fire
entries: You gain a +1 to attack and damage rolls with this item.
You can cast the {@spell scorching ray} spell from the lance (+5 attack bonus). This spell cannot be cast again from the lance again until next dawn.

Additionally, you can empower one of your strikes with elemental energy, increasing its strength by {@dice 1d10} fire damage. You must move 20 feet in a straight line and declare this effect before the attack is made. Using this effect expends a charge, of which you have 3. You regain all expended charges each dawn.
{@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}

item.name: Elemental Fang, Cold
entries: You gain a +1 to attack and damage rolls with this item.
You can cast the {@spell snilloc's snowball swarm} spell from the lance (DC 13). This spell cannot be cast again from the lance again until next dawn.

Additionally, you can empower one of your strikes with elemental energy, increasing its strength by {@dice 1d10} cold damage. You must move 20 feet in a straight line and declare this effect before the attack is made. Using this effect expends a charge, of which you have 3. You regain all expended charges each dawn.
{@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}

item.name: Elemental Fang, Acid
entries: You gain a +1 to attack and damage rolls with this item.
You can cast the {@spell melf's acid arrow} spell from the lance (+5 attack bonus). This spell cannot be cast again from the lance again until next dawn.

Additionally, you can empower one of your strikes with elemental energy, increasing its strength by {@dice 1d10} acid damage. You must move 20 feet in a straight line and declare this effect before the attack is made. Using this effect expends a charge, of which you have 3. You regain all expended charges each dawn.
{@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}

item.name: Elemental Fang, Lightning
entries: You gain a +1 to attack and damage rolls with this item.
You can cast the {@spell shatter} spell from the lance (DC 13). This spell cannot be cast again from the lance again until next dawn.

Additionally, you can empower one of your strikes with elemental energy, increasing its strength by {@dice 1d10} lightning damage. You must move 20 feet in a straight line and declare this effect before the attack is made. Using this effect expends a charge, of which you have 3. You regain all expended charges each dawn.
{@italic Item designed by @Aizea La Win#5106.}

item.name: Sigil of the Claw +1
entries: While wearing this sigil, you gain a +1 bonus to the attack rolls and the damage rolls you make with unarmed strikes and natural weapons. Such attacks are considered to be magical.

item.name: Sigil of the Claw +2
entries: While wearing this sigil, you gain a +2 bonus to the attack rolls and the damage rolls you make with unarmed strikes and natural weapons. Such attacks are considered to be magical. It does not provide this bonus when wielding unarmed weapons.

item.name: Sigil of the Claw +3
entries: While wearing this sigil, you gain a +3 bonus to the attack rolls and the damage rolls you make with unarmed strikes and natural weapons. Such attacks are considered to be magical. It does not provide this bonus when wielding unarmed weapons.

item.name: Bracer of Flying Daggers
entries: This armband appears to have thin {@item dagger|phb|daggers} strapped to it. As an action, you can pull up to two magic daggers from the bracer and immediately hurl them, making a ranged attack with each dagger. A dagger vanishes if you don't hurl it right away, and the daggers disappear right after they hit or miss. The bracer never runs out of daggers.

As a bonus action, the thrower can call back two of the illusory daggers, forcing all creatures in a line from where the daggers were launched to make a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Dexterity modifier). On a failed save, those creatures take {@dice 2d4} piercing damage.

Additionally, the user can slot one dagger into the bracer as an item interaction. Doing this causes all future thrown daggers take on the attributes of the slotted dagger. You can only slot one dagger in these bracers at a time.
{@italic Item edited by @Aizea La Win#5106.}

item.name: +1 Shield
entries: While holding this shield, you have a +1 bonus to AC. This bonus is in addition to the shield's normal bonus to AC.
A shield is made from wood or metal and is carried in one hand. Wielding a shield increases your Armor Class by 2. You can benefit from only one shield at a time.

item.name: Bag of Bounty
entries: This is a sturdy leather sack with tiny Siberys shards embedded into the lining. You can use an action to cast create food and water, drawing a feast from within the bag. You shape this meal with your thoughts. You can create the standard bland fare without requiring any sort of check, but you can attempt to create finer food by making a Charisma check; if you're proficient with cook's utensils, add your bonus to this check. A failed check results in a sour and squalid meal.
A bag of bounty can be used up to three times over the course of a day. After that, the bag can't be used again until the next dawn.
